page.title: 07SCHOOLDAYS RELIVED 1915/23.
page.content: We learned the alphabet and multiplication tables by rote. We had handwriting lessons,using slates and slate pencils. I remember one day when all the class got 2 strokes of the cane because no-one would own up to breaking a box of slate pencils. I felt particularly aggrieved as it was my birthday! We always wore white pinafores with frills on the shoulders,over our dresses, with handkerchiefs pinned to the front.On our feet we wore boots. I can remember giving a concert on the rectory lawn for bombed soldiers who were convalescing at Swillington House. It was a lovely day-looking back all the days seemed to be sunny. Before I left school,at the age of 13, council houses had been built in the village,and many folk came from the N.E.to work in the pits.
